definition: not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
(negative prefix)/not/no
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
to gather/to unite/to unify/whole

sentences.english: Short trousers are not proper at a dance.
sentences.chinese: 舞会上穿短裤不成体统。

sentences.english: He did not look at the woman as he spoke. It would not have been seemly .
sentences.chinese: 他说话的时候，没有去看女人，因为那是不成体统的。

sentences.english: The problem with Establishment Republicans is they abhor the unseemliness of a political brawl.
sentences.chinese: 共和党的人问题是他们厌恶不成体统的政治上的争斗。

sentences.english: My handwriting has gone down with using the computer so much.
sentences.chinese: 用电脑太多，我的字写得不成体统了。

sentences.english: Short trousers are improper at a dance.
sentences.chinese: 舞会上穿短裤不成体统。

sentences.english: It's considered improper to be unclothed in public.
sentences.chinese: 在公共场合赤身裸体被认为是不成体统的。

sentences.english: It wasn't quite the done thing for women to drink in pubs in those days.
sentences.chinese: 那年月女的到酒店喝酒可不成体统。

sentences.english: She behaved very badly at the party.
sentences.chinese: 她在聚会上的举止真不成体统。

sentences.english: This sort of thing simply isn't done.

definition: What a scandal!/Whatever next?
unreasonable/shocking/outrageous/also written 不像話|不像话
in no shape to be seen/unpresentable/beyond recognition
see 不像話|不像话[bu4 xiang4 hua4]
offending public morals (idiom)
decorum/propriety/arrangement or form (of piece of writing)
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
beyond belief/preposterous/absurd/intemperate/dissipated
to have no sense of shame/brazen
no respect for seniors/lacking in manners
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
out of place/inappropriate/incongruous
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
